headline.print_headline: Turkey Vows to Respond After Attack on Soldiers
headline.main: Car Bomb Strikes Military Convoy in Ankara, Killing 28, Officials Say

snippet: The bomb exploded close to the Parliament headquarters and other government buildings in the Turkish capital....
abstract: Deadly bombing of military convoy in Ankara, Turkey, prompts decisive action from President Recep Tayyip Erdogan who promises to retaliate by striking at enemies in Syria and elsewhere; officials believe Kurdish militants are responsible for attack.
lead_paragraph: The bomb exploded close to the Parliament headquarters and other government buildings in the Turkish capital.

byline.contributor: Christina Anderson contributed reporting from Halmstad, Sweden, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

headline.main: Many in Jakarta Seem to Shrug Off Terrorist Attack

snippet: Many in the Indonesian capital expressed astonishment that the assailants had killed only two people, and praised the police for quickly neutralizing the attackers....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Many in the Indonesian capital expressed astonishment that the assailants had killed only two people, and praised the police for quickly neutralizing the attackers.

byline.contributor: Thomas Fuller contributed reporting from Bangkok and Dewi Kurniawati from Jakarta.

headline.print_headline: Europe; France: Charlie Hebdo Plans Edition to Mark Anniversary of Massacre
headline.main: France: Charlie Hebdo Plans Edition to Mark Anniversary of Massacre

snippet: Seventeen people died at Charlie Hebdo in 2014 and in other attacks in the Paris area in the days that followed....
abstract: Surviving artists and writers for French satirical newspaper Charlie Hebdo release special edition marking one-year anniversary of Jan 7, 2014 attack on paper's staff that claimed 17 lives.
lead_paragraph: Seventeen people died at Charlie Hebdo in 2014 and in other attacks in the Paris area in the days that followed.

headline.print_headline: 4 Gunmen Die as They Attack Base in India
headline.main: Gunmen Killed in Pathankot, India, Air Base Attack

snippet: At least four attackers were killed as Indian authorities defended the base in Punjab State. Several Indian security force members were also reported dead....
abstract: Indian security forces kill four gunmen who attacked Air Force base in Punjab region near border with Pakistan; assault follows visit by Prime Min Narendra Modi to Pakistan, whose government has often been accused of assisting insurgents in disputed neighboring Jammu and Kashmir region.
lead_paragraph: At least four attackers were killed as Indian authorities defended the base in Punjab State. Several Indian security force members were also reported dead.

headline.print_headline: Mosul Fight Unleashes New Horrors on Civilians
headline.main: Mosul Fight Unleashes New Horrors on Civilians

snippet: The Islamic State is carrying out mass killings and using human shields. Refugees are being turned away over fears terrorist sleeper cells. Burning sulfur has sickened dozens....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

abstract: Islamic State is subjecting civilians to fresh horrors as Iraqi military moves to retake Mosul, killing nearly 200 and using others as human shields; violence provides glimpse of possible humanitarian crisis that may follow reclamation of city.
lead_paragraph: The Islamic State is carrying out mass killings and using human shields. Refugees are being turned away over fears terrorist sleeper cells. Burning sulfur has sickened dozens.

byline.contributor: Nick Cumming-Bruce contributed reporting from Geneva, Falih Hassan from Erbil, and an employee of The New York Times from Kirkuk, Iraq.

headline.print_headline: Pakistan Reels as Attack on Police College Leaves 61 Dead
headline.main: Pakistan Reels After Attack on Police Training College Leaves 61 Dead

snippet: The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack, outside Quetta, but Pakistani officials had blamed Lashkar-e-Jhangvi, a Taliban affiliate....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations

abstract: Islamic State group claims responsibility for attack by three men on police training college in southwest Pakistan that left at least 61 dead and 120 wounded.
lead_paragraph: The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the attack, outside Quetta, but Pakistani officials had blamed Lashkar-e-Jhangvi, a Taliban affiliate.

headline.print_headline: Bomber Kills 11 at Pakistani Court Complex
headline.main: Pakistan Suicide Bombing Kills at Least 11 at Court Compound

snippet: The assault at a district court in the city of Mardan was the second mass attack in recent weeks that appeared to target lawyers....
abstract: Suicide bombing attack on district court compound in northwestern city of Mardan kills at least 11 people and injures 20; Jamaat-e-Ahrar, offshoot of Pakistani Taliban, claims responsibility.
lead_paragraph: The assault at a district court in the city of Mardan was the second mass attack in recent weeks that appeared to target lawyers.

headline.main: At Least 7 Dead as Shabab Militants Attack Restaurant in Somali Capital

snippet: The Shabab have carried out a series of deadly attacks in Somalia to try to topple the Western-backed government of the country....
lead_paragraph: The Shabab have carried out a series of deadly attacks in Somalia to try to topple the Western-backed government of the country.

headline.main: Jacques Hamel, 85, a Beloved French Priest, Killed in His Church

snippet: The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the knife attack on Father Hamel as he was celebrating Mass....
lead_paragraph: The Islamic State claimed responsibility for the knife attack on Father Hamel as he was celebrating Mass.

byline.contributor: Daphné Anglès, Martin de Bourmont and Benoît Morenne contributed reporting.
